description: Ms. codex. Title from fol. 2b. Physical description: 15 lines per page in two columns; written in naskhi script in black on white paper. Rubrication, catchwords, a few marginal notes. Vocalized. Fol. 2b-3a framed in gold with simple gold ʻunwan. Remainder of text framed in red. Fol. 1 blank. Origin: Copied in 1225 AH (1826 AD) by Ḥāfiẓ ʻAbd al-Raḥīm (fol. 20b).
extent: 20 leaves : paper ; 224 x 159 (160 x 98) mm. bound to 224 x 161 mm.
subject: Islamic poetry, Turkish
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
